body: @jiang-wei Thank you very much for your feedback. The create sequence statement is not currently supported, and we will support it in subsequent versions as soon as possible. 😀
@fanyetu Can you try the latest 5.0.0-alpha version?
hi， i fix it  to today， can you close this pr？
Hi , plz assige me,I want to have a try,thx
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
fix the confilcts first.

`/usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk-11.0.10.0.9-0.fc33.aarch64/../bin/javadoc' doesn't exist or is not a file`

Please check your JDK installation.
Hi i want to try it
I want do it too
I guess the newly created table is not picked up by SS to save into "unconfiguredSchemaMetaDataMap"

In 5.0.0, the default sharding datasource is removed.
SS loads all tables at startup and configure the sharding policy on them.

For newly created tables there's no way to tell SS to load them.
I run liquibase scripts with another datasource because #9774 , SS cannot create sequence...

Log:

```
2021-03-23 14:48:46.199  INFO 93803 --- [           main] ShardingSphere-metadata                  : Loading 0 tables' meta data for unconfigured tables.
```

BTW, I found a way to fool SS to "create" the tables 
just run `create table` in SS like
```
create table foo if not exists (u_id BIGINT);
```
then SS will configure it with default non-sharding policy 

😎😎😎

Pls check binlog file exists.

@tristaZero  integrated tests failed, because datasource getConnection timeout. In class `org.apache.shardingsphere.test.integration.env.datasource.builder.ActualDataSourceBuilder.createHikariCP` create datasource need increase MaximumPoolSize to 10. I test in my local is pass.

@tristaZero After analyzing the code, I found that the old datasource connection pool is only 2. when  integrated tests multiple threads acquire a connection concurrently, some threads will wait for a timeout. so just modify MaximumPoolSize  to 10.

Hi @zhujunxxxxx ,

> After analyzing the code, I found that the old datasource connection pool is only 2. when integrated tests multiple 

But the question is why the MySQL scenario can run well? Please set `it.databases=MySQL` in `env/engine-env.properties` and run `GeneralDQLIT`. As you know, your file will be called in the same position with `MySQLTableMetaDataLoader`, right?

Besides, `loadColumnMetaDataMap` of this PR creates two connections in parallel.

> Hi, could you firstly start Proxy with the example yaml configuration?
> It is senseless to say proxy can run but we still need more detail to verify there is a bug or not.

I ran into the same problem and there are no more logs。

> But the question is why the MySQL scenario can run well? 

Yes，I known the reason ,  I debug found `org.apache.shardingsphere.infra.metadata.schema.builder.SchemaBuilder.appendRemainTables`  method run in MySQL scenario  `findDialectTableMetaDataLoader` will return `Optional.empty()` so `appendRemainTables` will go to `appendDefaultRemainTables` metod，it will not use `MySQLTableMetaDataLoader` to load metadata.  because testcase use database type is H2，so in my scenario findDialectTableMetaDataLoader will return `H2TableMetaDataLoader`

> @tristaZero integrated tests failed, because datasource getConnection timeout. In class `org.apache.shardingsphere.test.integration.env.datasource.builder.ActualDataSourceBuilder.createHikariCP` create datasource need increase MaximumPoolSize to 10. I test in my local is pass.

IMO, The problem is not caused byMaximumPoolSize . The configuration here is similar to the configuration as follows:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76552510/112291713-54917280-8ccb-11eb-9545-9d2d5fd75833.png)
I think the reason for the PR is more likely to be caused by other factors such as concurrency.
Hello i want to know how to open circuit break mode， @terrymanu @strongduanmu
There is unnecessary to add ack after event post, I just close this PR

@romantictravel01 You can refer to this article——https://www.jianshu.com/p/41ebdaf403c8.

I found that the `sqlState` length defined by mysql error packet is `5`, but we defined it as` 6`. This will happen to all `errorMsgs`. I would like to modify our defined length to` 5`. Take a look. If this design is unreasonable, I will Try another method.
@SammyXue Thank you very much for your feedback, I will investigate this issue later.
@larrychen8276 This is an `antlr` parsing exception. You can upgrade to the latest version, which is already supported.

@tristaZero I solved the continuous integration testing problem by reusing the connection. 
@JiekerTime thanks for you advice, it's work.
issue resolved
@totalo  Thank you, the change is excellent, I will do a little research and merge it soon

@romantictravel01 At present, the main work of the SS community is focused on the development and improvement of new features of the 5.x version. There is no plan for the upgrade of the seata version. If you are interested, you are welcome to submit a PR to complete this work. 😀

我也出现了这个问题，有解决么

the problem solved
huawei cloud make a binlog manage system themselves
expire_logs_days is not effective now
change the binlog expire time by their system then the problem solved
Fixed via https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/pull/9746

@jackjoesh @bwzhang2011 

I have improved the performance recently, please refer to https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/9616 and https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/9826 . 

The TPS is proved to be increased by 12% and 15% respectively by sysbench test result of ShardingSphere-Proxy. The CPU load also decreased significantly. 

It's expected that the ShardingSphere-JDBC can get the similiar result. 

These two PRs will be included in the next release, may be 5.0.0-RC1.
